examples.sentence: Use particles to show grammatical role
Always come at the end of the sentence/clause
Usually come before what they modify
Verbs: 食べる → 食べます → 食べた
I-adjectives: 大きい → 大きくない → 大きかった
Copula: です → だ → でした
Na-adjectives: 静か (always 静か, only add な/だ)
Adverbs: ゆっくり (always ゆっくり)

sections.heading: Overview
sections.content: Japanese has similar parts of speech to English, but with important differences in how they function.

sections.heading: 1. Nouns (名詞 - Meishi)
sections.content:
Definition: Words that name people, places, things, or concepts.

本 (hon) - book 東京 (toukyou) - Tokyo 学生 (gakusei) - student 愛 (ai) - love

children.heading: Key Features
children.content:
Don't change form for plural No articles (no "a" or "the") Use particles to show grammatical role

本 (hon) = "book" or "books" or "the book" Context determines specificity

children.heading: Types
children.content:
Common nouns: 犬 (dog), 車 (car) Proper nouns: 日本 (Japan), 太郎 (Tarou) Abstract nouns: 幸せ (happiness), 時間 (time)

See: Noun Basics for complete guide

sections.heading: 2. Verbs (動詞 - Doushi)
sections.content:
Definition: Words that describe actions or states.

食べる (taberu) - to eat 行く (iku) - to go ある (aru) - to exist

children.heading: Key Features
children.content:
Always come at the end of the sentence/clause Conjugate for tense, politeness, negative Three groups: Godan, Ichidan, Irregular

食べる → 食べます (polite) → 食べない (negative) → 食べた (past)

children.heading: Types
children.content:
Action verbs: 走る (run), 書く (write) State verbs: いる (exist - animate), ある (exist - inanimate) Suru verbs: 勉強する (study), 運転する (drive)

See: Verb Basics for complete guide

sections.heading: 3. Adjectives
sections.content: Japanese has two types of adjectives, functioning differently from English adjectives.

children.heading: I-adjectives (い形容詞)
children.content:
End in い and conjugate like verbs:

大きい (ookii) - big 高い (takai) - tall/expensive 面白い (omoshiroi) - interesting 大きい → 大きくない (not big) → 大きかった (was big)

children.heading: Na-adjectives (な形容詞)
children.content:
Behave like nouns, add な before nouns:

静か (shizuka) - quiet きれい (kirei) - beautiful/clean 便利 (benri) - convenient 静かな部屋 (shizuka na heya) - quiet room

children.heading: Key Difference
children.content:
I-adj: 大きい犬 (big dog) - no particle needed Na-adj: 静かな犬 (quiet dog) - な required

See: Adjective Basics for complete guide

sections.heading: 4. Particles (助詞 - Joshi)
sections.content:
Definition: Small words that mark grammatical relationships. No direct English equivalent.

は (wa) - topic marker が (ga) - subject marker を (wo) - object marker に (ni) - location/direction/time で (de) - location of action/means と (to) - and/with

children.heading: Key Features
children.content:
Don't translate directly to English Show word function in sentence Enable flexible word order Essential for correct grammar

私は本を読む I (topic) book (object) read "I read books"

See: Particles Overview for complete guide

sections.heading: 5. Adverbs (副詞 - Fukushi)
sections.content:
Definition: Words that modify verbs, adjectives, or other adverbs.

ゆっくり (yukkuri) - slowly とても (totemo) - very よく (yoku) - often/well 全然 (zenzen) - not at all

children.heading: Key Features
children.content:
Don't conjugate Usually come before what they modify Can be formed from adjectives

From i-adj: 早い → 早く (quickly) From na-adj: 静か → 静かに (quietly)

children.heading: Types
children.content: Time: 今 (now), 昨日 (yesterday) Frequency: いつも (always), ときどき (sometimes) Degree: とても (very), 少し (a little) Manner: ゆっくり (slowly), 速く (quickly)

sections.heading: 6. Copula (助動詞 - Jodoushi)
sections.content:
Definition: The verb "to be" in Japanese.

です (desu) - polite "is" だ (da) - plain "is" である (de aru) - formal "is"

children.heading: Usage
children.content:
私は学生です "I am a student" これは本だ "This is a book"

Not a true verb - doesn't conjugate like action verbs.

See: です/だ Copula for complete guide

children.heading: Personal Pronouns
children.content: 私 (watashi) - I (neutral) 僕 (boku) - I (male, casual) 俺 (ore) - I (male, rough) あなた (anata) - you (careful usage) 彼 (kare) - he 彼女 (kanojo) - she

children.heading: Demonstratives (こそあど system)
children.content: これ (kore) - this それ (sore) - that (near you) あれ (are) - that (over there) どれ (dore) - which

children.heading: Key Feature
children.content:
Pronouns are often omitted when clear from context:

何を食べますか？ "What will (you) eat?" 寿司を食べます "(I) will eat sushi"

See: Pronouns for complete guide

sections.heading: 8. Conjunctions (接続詞 - Setsuzokushi)
sections.content:
Definition: Words that connect clauses or sentences.

そして (soshite) - and then しかし (shikashi) - however でも (demo) - but だから (dakara) - therefore または (matawa) - or

children.heading: Usage
children.content:
雨が降った。だから、家にいた。 "It rained. Therefore, I stayed home."

Can also use て-form to connect:

雨が降って、家にいた "It rained and I stayed home"

sections.heading: 9. Counters (助数詞 - Josuushi)
sections.content:
Definition: Special suffixes used with numbers to count objects.

一つ (hitotsu) - one (general) 二人 (futari) - two people 三冊 (sansatsu) - three books 四匹 (yonhiki) - four small animals

children.heading: Key Feature
children.content:
Different counters for different object types:

本 (hon) - long objects 枚 (mai) - flat objects 匹 (hiki) - small animals 頭 (tou) - large animals

See: Counters for complete guide

sections.heading: 10. Interjections (感動詞 - Kandoushi)
sections.content:
Definition: Expressions of emotion or reaction.

ああ (aa) - ah おお (oo) - oh えっ (e) - what? huh? わあ (waa) - wow

Stand alone and don't modify other words.

sections.heading: Comparison to English
sections.content: | Part of Speech | Japanese | English | Key Difference | | -------------- | ----------- | --------- | ------------------------- | | Noun | 本 | book | No plural forms | | Verb | 食べる | to eat | Sentence-final position | | Adjective | 大きい/静か | big/quiet | Two types (i-adj, na-adj) | | Particle | は、が、を | (none) | Unique to Japanese | | Adverb | ゆっくり | slowly | Similar function | | Copula | です/だ | is/am/are | Single form | | Pronoun | 私 | I/me | Often omitted | | Counter | 匹、枚 | (none) | Unique system |

sections.heading: Word Order by Part of Speech
sections.content:
[Time] [Topic] [Indirect Object] [Location] [Object] [Adverb] [Verb] 昨日 私は 友達に 図書館で 本を ゆっくり 読んだ

Each part of speech has its typical position, though order can vary.

children.heading: Conjugate (Change Form)
children.content: Verbs: 食べる → 食べます → 食べた I-adjectives: 大きい → 大きくない → 大きかった Copula: です → だ → でした

children.heading: Don't Conjugate
children.content: Nouns: 本 (always 本) Na-adjectives: 静か (always 静か, only add な/だ) Adverbs: ゆっくり (always ゆっくり) Particles: は、が、を (never change)

sections.heading: How They Work Together
sections.content:
私は 昨日 図書館で 面白い 本を ゆっくり 読んだ Pronoun Adverb Noun+Ptcl I-adj Noun+Ptcl Adverb Verb Topic Time Location Modifier Object Manner Action

Each part plays its role in creating meaning.

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Nouns don't have plural forms ✓ Verbs always come last ✓ Two types of adjectives (i-adj and na-adj) ✓ Particles are unique to Japanese ✓ Pronouns often omitted ✓ Counters required with numbers ✓ Understanding parts of speech helps build sentences correctly

Master these categories and their functions to construct grammatically correct Japanese sentences.

Next: Particles Overview
